snippet: Promoted as a humane method of execution when it was installed in the state prison at San Quentin in 1938, California's gas chamber goes on trial on Monday on the ground that it causes a needlessly painful death.   The suit, filed in Federal Distr...
lead_paragraph: Promoted as a humane method of execution when it was installed in the state prison at San Quentin in 1938, California's gas chamber goes on trial on Monday on the ground that it causes a needlessly painful death. The suit, filed in Federal District Court by the American Civil Liberties Union, has the potential to cause gas chambers to close in the states that still have them. While that is probably a long shot, given the conservative majority on the United States Supreme Court, the case could at least accelerate a trend against executions by gas.

headline.main: California Suit Challenges State's Use of Gas Chamber
